title: Paris Olympics: Teddy Riner, a champion with an exceptionally long career
summary: The French judoka further cemented his place among the legends of his sport by winning his third gold medal in the over 100kg category. On Saturday, he led his country's mixed team to another Olympic title.

title: Simone Biles wins vault and third gymnastics gold, considers LA Olympics in 2028: 'Never say never'
summary: The American earned her 10th Olympic medal, her seventh gold, by winning the women's vault final for a second time in Paris. Biles then addressed the potential of competing in the Los Angeles Olympics: 'The next Olympics is at home, so you just never know, but I am getting really old.'

title: American swimmer Katie Ledecky Claims makes history with ninth career Olympic gold
summary: The 27-year-old is tied with former gymnast Larisa Latynina as the only women ever to collect that many titles. Ledecky is the only female swimmer who has won gold at four different Olympics: London, Rio, Tokyo and Paris. As for a potential 2028 Los Angeles Olympics: 'I'd love to, we'll see.'

title: Ukraine wins its first gold medal of the Paris Olympics in women's team saber fencing
summary: Ukraine had two medals before Saturday's final; a silver in shooting from Serhiy Kulish and the bronze that Kharlan won Monday in women's saber.

title: Bob Bowman: Marchand 'can go much further than this'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the American coach of the French swimmer, now four-time Olympic champion, looks back on his pupil's performances and ahead to what's next.

title: Paris Olympics: 'Dream merchant' Léon Marchand wins fourth gold medal
summary: The 22-year-old French swimmer won the 200m individual medley on Friday. Marchand is contributing to restoring the prestige of a category that used to be disregarded for its difficulty.

title: Paris Olympics: France's historic triple-victory wipes away Tokyo upset
summary: Cyclists Joris Daudet, Sylvain André and Romain Mahieu, in that order, dominated the BMX racing event on Friday, a feat France had not achieved at the Summer Olympics for a century.

title: Belgium's Remco Evenepoel delivers historic Olympic double gold for cycling: 'So proud to win this'
summary: Evenepoel, 24, is the only man to have ridden the Olympic double. Dutch cyclist Leontien Zijlaard completed the women's double at the 2000 Olympics in Sydney.

title: Le Monde's Paris Olympics guide. Day 9: So many finals, so little time.
summary: Need a hand navigating the Olympics? Whether you're in the French capital for the sport, the culture or the food, Le Monde's English edition has got you covered with a handy guide full of practical information and secret tips.

title: Indian spices targeted by health authorities worldwide
summary: Since the detection of a carcinogenic agent in spices intended for export, measures to inspect and recall these seasonings have increased.

title: Far-right protesters clash with police as UK unrest spreads
summary: Demonstrators threw chairs, flares and bricks at officers in the northwestern English city of Liverpool while scuffles between police and protesters broke out in nearby Manchester. Police said 'a number of officers have been injured as they deal with serious disorder.'

title: US, UK urge citizens to leave Lebanon immediately
summary: Fears of a regional war are growing after the assassination of Hamas's political leader, blamed on Israel, triggered vows of vengeance from Iran-backed Middle East groups.

title: Trump says he will debate with Harris on Fox News in September
summary: The Harris campaign dismissed the announcement as 'games,' as the VP secured the official Democratic nomination on Friday, backed by near unanimous party support.

title: The Holy Family Church, a precarious sanctuary for Gaza's Christians
summary: Around 500 parishioners are crammed into the religious complex, with very little food, one hour of electricity a day and the din of bombing raids all around them.

title: Four French MPs and a deluge of hatred. Does anyone care?
summary: Four radical-left MPs sat on a bench in the Assemblée Nationale on the first day of the new parliamentary session, and X users went wild. Le Modne's fashion columnist looked into the picture more closely.

title: Dissidents freed in prisoner swap recount details of release, vow to keep up fight against Putin
summary: The historic trade was in the works for months and unfolded despite relations between Washington and Moscow being at their lowest point since the Cold War.

title: Prisoner exchange between West and Russia is a diplomatic success with a bitter aftertaste
summary: Twenty-four people imprisoned in seven different countries, and two minors accompanying their parents, passed through Turkey's Ankara airport on Thursday, as part of the largest exchange ever organized since the fall of the Soviet Union.

title: Paris Olympics: Plastic as ever-present as Coca-Cola at Olympic venues, despite promises of 'green' Games
summary: Paris 2024 pledged to crack down on plastic for a sustainable Games, but in many Olympic venues, reusable cups are filled from small plastic bottles.

title: In Israel, the hostages' families fight their 'despair'
summary: Several thousand people demonstrated in Tel Aviv to demand an agreement on the 300th day of their loved ones' captivity – they were kidnapped by Hamas on October 7, 2023.

title: Paris Olympics: Biniam Girmay, the cyclist all of Africa has been waiting for
summary: The Tour de France 2024 green jersey starts the Paris Olympics road race on Saturday, where he will be the sole representative of his country, Eritrea.

title: Warren Buffett sells half of his stake in Apple
summary: The 93-year-old billionaire finds himself in charge of a huge pile of cash: $277 billion, a quarter of his assets.

title: Thousands in Venezuela protest reelection of President Nicolas Maduro
summary: Eleven civilians reportedly have died and more than 1,000 have been detained in the protests that erupted after the country's CNE election authority, loyal to Maduro, proclaimed him the winner with 52% of the vote to 43% for Gonzalez Urrutia.

title: How much does it cost to attend the Paris Olympics?
summary: Some visitors spare no expense for a once-in-a-lifetime event. Others get by on a very tight budget and a few concessions.

title: Paris 2024: Counterfeit goods, cocaine and doping products, trafficking under close surveillance
summary: The Olympic Games can be an opportunity to smuggle illicit products in a variety of ways. At Roissy-Charles-de-Gaulle airport, customs controls have been stepped up, but so far no Olympic effect has been observed.

title: Olympic women's football: Quarter-final curse continues for France, eliminated by Brazil
summary: Unable to qualify for the last four in seven of the last eight major international competitions, Les Bleues leave the Olympic tournament after a new disappointment.

title: France calls on citizens in Lebanon to leave 'as soon as possible'
summary: France joined the US and UK in calling on nationals to travel to Lebanon because of fears of a regional conflagration. Hezbollah said Saturday it launched rockets at Israel.
